results.title: The Grudge 2 = Ju-on 2
results.creator_credit: Kadokawa Shoten Publishing Company, Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha, Takashige Ichise and Takashi Shimizu
results.brief_description: In this sequel to “The Grudge”, a Tokyo house has been the site of many strange disappearances. A television crew go to investigate the site, setting off a spate of killings by the evil spirit that dwells there. Although not as well received as “The Grudge” this horror film contains a convoluted narrative, but contains exemplary scares and thrills, fitting for the genre, with a chilling finale. Cast includes: Noriko Sakai, Chiharu Niiyama and Kei Horie.

results.title: The Grudge = Ju-on (2003)
results.creator_credit: Aozora Investment, Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha, Takashige Ichise and Takashi Shimizu
results.brief_description: Suitably scary J-horror that draws appealingly on the tropes of the genre with disgruntled spirits rising to haunt the terrified living. When a young social worker helps out an elderly woman, she finds a young boy residing in a spooky house. Each investigating person becomes troubled by menacing spirits, until a detective attempts to destroy the house. Aping the very successful style of “The Ring” (Hideo Nakata, 1998), Takashi Shimizu engages in elliptical narrative threads, whilst providing requisite scares and thrills. This film is a big-screen re-working of “Ju-on” and “Ju-on 2” two low budget Shimizu films. Cast includes: Megumi Okina, Misaki Ito, Kanji Tsuda, Shuri Matsuda, and Misa Uehara.

results.title: The Growth of flowers
results.brief_description: A series of time-lapse studies of roses, orchids, viruses, jack-in-pulpits, and daffodils, as their buds grow and swell and the flower opens out from the bud.

results.title: The Growing of a young filmaker
results.brief_description: A documentary about a high school dropout. Uses scenes and narrative from movies which he made to show how his attitude toward learning was changed from apathy to zeal by his movie-making experiences.

results.title: The Grizzlies
results.brief_description: Monster of the imagination and monarch of the wild, the great grizzly bear has long played a part in myth and legend. Despite man’s combined fear of and fascination with the grizzly, the bear survives today only by consent of his one real contender - man. Travel from Alaska’s Brooks Range to Wyoming’s Yellowstone National Park for an illuminating portrait of this powerful, intelligent and extremely aggressive creature.

results.title: The Grinch
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Brian Grazer and Ron Howard
results.brief_description: In Whoville, the Whos are overexcited, preparing for both Christmas, and the town’s ‘Whobelation’, a celebration of everything ‘Who’. The Grinch (Jim Carrey), living on Mount Crumpet overlooking the town of Whoville, despises everything about the holiday season and the town (due to a bad childhood Christmas experience) and decides to stop the festive season all together. Meanwhile, down in Whoville little Cindy Lou Who is trying to discover the true meaning behind Christmas and believes the Grinch might have the answers. A live-action adaptation of Dr. Seuss’s Christmas classic ‘How the Grinch Stole Christmas’, narrated by Anthony Hopkins. Cast also includes Molly Shannon, Christine Baranski, Bill Irwin and Jeffrey Tambor.

results.title: The Grievance
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the orderly processing of a grievance though several stages of negotiation between union and management, showing how the right of a worker with a genuine grievance are protected under the union’s contract. It shows the case of an unto-worker who was demoted for refusing to work inside a truck cab he considered too hot. The union registers the case as a legitimate grievance; it passes through three stages of negotiation in the plant, and eventually reaches an impartial arbitrator for the settlement.
